tool_name: Mapilion - Vector and Raster Map Tiles
tool_description: Mapilion provides you with vector and raster map tiles at scale. Based on OpenStreetMap and OpenMapTiles.
title: Mapilion - Vector and Raster Map Tiles

api_list.name: Get Vector Tile
api_list.description: Returns Vector tiles following the OpenMapTiles schema
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com/rapid-api/vector/{z}/{x}/{y}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Hillshading Tile
api_list.description: Returns special hillshading Raster tiles as PNG. Hillshading can be used as an overlay to create the look and feel of mountains. The version can be either v1 or v2.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com/rapid-api/hillshades/{version}/{z}/{x}/{y}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Tile Json
api_list.description:
Returns the tile json for the give style. Currently there are three different types:
- `v3` the OpenMapTiles compatible vector tiles
- `hillshading-v1` Hillshading tiles Version 1
- `hillshading-v2` Hillshading tiles Version 2
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com/rapid-api/tilejson/{type}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Fonts
api_list.description: Returns Fonts for vector tiles. This endpoint is typically used in your style.json.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com/rapid-api/fonts/{fontstack}/{range}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Style Json
api_list.description:
Returns the style json for the given style. These are pre-configured styles to get started easily. For advanced use cases we recommend to extend these styles or create a new style. The following styles are currently available:
- `osm-bright` Osm-Bright
- `osm-bright-hillshading-v1` Osm-Bright with Hillshading V1 overlay
- `osm-bright-hillshading-v2` Osm-Bright with Hillshading V2 overlay
- `dark-matter` A dark map style.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com/rapid-api/stylejson/{style}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Raster Tile
api_list.description:
Returns Raster tiles as PNG. These can be used in mapping libraries like Leaflet. The style-name can be one of:
- `kurviger-liberty` a map style developed for Kurviger.de
- `osm-bright` the default Osm Bright style
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com/rapid-api/raster/{style_name}/{z}/{x}/{y}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mapilion-vector-and-raster-map-tiles.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())
